page.title: 08EDUCATION : PUBLIC SCHOOLS
page.content: {Brighton College}has 450 pupils including girls from 16 years and a co-educational junior department of 200 boys and 25 girls. There is also a pre prep of boys and girls on the campus catering for the 4-8 age group. There is also a remedial centre for dyslexic boys forming part of the College. Brighton College was founded at a meeting of townsmen in 1845 with the object of providing a practical education. It now tends to follow the pattern of the disappearing Grammar Schools and offers a number of extra curricular activities.{St.Mary's Hall is similar catering for girls from 8-18, it enjoys a fine academic reputation as well as catering for the girls needs in music and physical education.
